title: 1994–95 Belarusian First League
text:
1994–95 Belarusian First League was the fourth season of 2nd level <a href="Association%20football">football</a> championship in <a href="Belarus">Belarus</a>. It started in July 1994 and ended in June 1995.
Team changes from 1993–94 season.
Winners of <a href="1993%E2%80%9394%20Belarusian%20First%20League">1993–94 First League</a> (<a href="FC%20Lida">Obuvshchik Lida</a>) were promoted to <a href="Belarusian%20Premier%20League">Belarusian Premier League</a>. They were replaced by the last placed team of <a href="1993%E2%80%9394%20Belarusian%20Premier%20League">1993–94 Premier League</a> (<a href="FC%20Starye%20Dorogi">Stroitel Starye Dorogi</a>).
<a href="FC%20Smena%20Minsk">Smena Minsk</a>, who finished 15th, relegated to the <a href="1994%E2%80%9395%20Belarusian%20Second%20League">Second League</a>. They were replaced by two best teams of <a href="1993%E2%80%9394%20Belarusian%20Second%20League">1993–94 Second League</a> (<a href="FC%20Belcard%20Grodno">Kardan-Flyers Grodno</a> and <a href="FC%20Ataka%20Minsk">Ataka-Aura Minsk</a>). The number of participating teams thus was restored to 16.
Before the start of the season Selmash Mogilev were renamed to <a href="FC%20Transmash%20Mogilev">Transmash Mogilev</a>. During the winter break, Polesye Mozyr changed their name to <a href="FC%20Slavia%20Mozyr">MPKC Mozyr</a> and KIM-2 Vitebsk changed their name to <a href="FC%20Vitebsk-2">Kimovets Vitebsk</a>.
Overview.
<a href="FC%20Slavia%20Mozyr">MPKC Mozyr</a> won the tournament and were promoted to the <a href="Belarusian%20Premier%20League">Premier League</a>, as were runners-up <a href="FC%20Ataka%20Minsk">Ataka-Aura Minsk</a>. <a href="FC%20ZLiN%20Gomel">ZLiN Gomel</a>, <a href="FC%20RShVSM-Olympia%20Minsk">AFViS-RShVSM Minsk</a> and <a href="FC%20Stroitel%20Vitebsk">Stroitel Vitebsk</a>, who finished 14th, 15th and 16th respectively, relegated to the <a href="1995%20Belarusian%20Second%20League">Second League</a>. <a href="FC%20BGATU-Niva%20Samokhvalovichi">Santanas Samokhvalovichi</a>, who finished 8th, withdrew to the amateur level after the season due to financial troubles.
